metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 3
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: What is the real GDP growth projected by the Reserve Bank for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank's baseline projection for real GDP growth for 2024-25 is 7.0 per cent. (Page 18, Table I.3)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the December 2023 MPC meeting, the real GDP growth projection for 2023-24 was revised upwards to what percentage?
questions.explanation: At the time of the December 2023 meeting, the projection of real GDP growth for 2023-24 was revised up to 7.0 per cent. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To ease potential liquidity stress, the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) was reduced by 50 bps in December 2024. What is the new CRR as a percentage of NDTL?
questions.explanation: The CRR of banks was reduced by 50 bps in two equal tranches of 25 bps each, bringing it down to 4.0 per cent of Net Demand and Time Liabilities (NDTL) effective from the fortnight beginning December 28, 2024. (Page 86, 112, 285)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year beginning on April 1, 2025, what is the income tax rate for an individual under the new tax regime for total income up to Rs. 3,00,000?
questions.explanation: As per the revised tax slab table for the assessment year beginning on or after April 1, 2025, under section 115BAC, the rate of tax for total income up to Rs. 3,00,000 is Nil. (Page 52)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India's weightage in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index (MSCI-EMI) increased significantly by November 2024. What was the new weightage?
questions.explanation: The Indian equity market outperformed its emerging market peers, leading to an increase in India’s weightage in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index (MSCI-EMI) to 19.9 per cent in November 2024. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of March 2025, the ownership share of Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) in NSE-listed companies surpassed that of Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs). What were their respective ownership shares?
questions.explanation: As of March 2025, FPI ownership in NSE-listed companies touched a decadal low at 17.5%, while DIIs' share surpassed it, reaching 18.1%. (Source: Page 41, Chart 1.27d)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect on 1st August 2025, the threshold for 'substantial interest' has been redefined from ₹5 lakh to what revised amount?
questions.explanation: A key amendment in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from 1st August 2025, was to redefine the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had remained unchanged since 1968.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Throughout the financial year 2023-24, what was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: Considering the growth-inflation dynamics, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent during 2023-24. (Page 29, Para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the targeted production capacity of Green Hydrogen per annum under the National Green Hydrogen Mission?
questions.explanation: The National Green Hydrogen Mission aims to achieve a production capacity of about five million metric tonnes per annum of Green Hydrogen. (Page 290, Para 10.42)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering India's international engagements in 2025, including advocating for MDB reforms at the G20, proposing a BRICS payment system, and signing the RCEP agreement, what is the most coherent strategic objective reflected by these actions?

options.A: A complete shift away from Western-led financial institutions towards Eastern alliances.
options.B: An isolationist policy focused on building self-reliant economic structures.
options.C: A pursuit of greater strategic autonomy by diversifying economic partnerships and reforming global governance.
options.D: Prioritizing regional trade over global trade to reduce supply chain vulnerabilities.
options.E: A diplomatic strategy focused solely on increasing India's voting power at the IMF and World Bank.

questions.explanation: These diverse actions collectively point towards a nuanced foreign policy. Proposing a BRICS payment system and advocating for MDB reforms aim to create alternatives and reform existing structures. Signing RCEP indicates engaging with key trade blocs. This multi-pronged approach reflects a desire for greater strategic autonomy and a more influential role in a multipolar world, rather than a complete shift or isolationism.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To combat rising inflation, the Reserve Bank of India increased the repo rate in its February 2025 monetary policy review. By how many basis points was the rate increased?
questions.explanation: In February 2025, the RBI increased the repo rate by 25 basis points, taking it from 6.50% to 6.75%, as a measure to control inflation.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the value of the Reserve Bank of India’s Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index) as of March 2024?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India’s Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index), which captures the extent of financial inclusion across the country, stood at 64.2 in March 2024, an increase from 60.1 in March 2023. (Page 24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the first advance estimates for 2024-25, what was the estimated positive contribution of net exports to the overall GDP growth?
questions.explanation: The bulletin states that on the external front for FY 2024-25, exports grew by 5.9 per cent while imports contracted by 1.3 per cent. This dynamic enabled net exports to contribute positively to GDP growth by 1.7 percentage points. (Page 16)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Effective from April 1, 2025, the standard deduction for salaried individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) has been revised. What is the new deduction amount?
questions.explanation: A proviso has been inserted in section 16(ia) stating that for income-tax computed under section 115BAC, the deduction shall be 'seventy-five thousand rupees' instead of 'fifty thousand rupees'. (Page 39)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In December 2024, the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) for banks was reduced to what percentage of Net Demand and Time Liabilities (NDTL)?
questions.explanation: To ease potential liquidity stress, the CRR of banks was reduced by 50 bps to 4.0 per cent of NDTL in December 2024. (Page 112, 116)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with which major economic bloc, marking a significant milestone in its trade policy?
questions.explanation: India and the European Union signed a landmark Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement in March 2025, aiming to significantly boost bilateral trade and investment.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the analysis of distributional characteristics of household inflation expectations, which of the following measures were found to be significant with a negative sign, suggesting their utility in predicting one year ahead inflation?

options.E: Standard deviation, Interquartile range, and Skewness

questions.explanation: The model's estimates suggest that measures of dispersion like standard deviation and interquartile range, as well as skewness, are significant with a negative sign in predicting one year ahead inflation, whereas median and mean were found to be not significant. (Page 16, Table I.1.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its December 2024 meeting, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR). What was the quantum of the cut and the expected liquidity infusion?

options.A: Cut to 4.25% from 4.5%, infusing ₹0.96 lakh crore
options.B: Cut to 4.0% from 4.5%, infusing ₹1.16 lakh crore
options.C: Cut to 3.75% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.25 lakh crore
options.D: Cut to 4.0% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.00 lakh crore
options.E: Cut to 3.5% from 4.0%, infusing ₹1.36 lakh crore

questions.explanation: In its December 2024 meeting, the MPC announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4 per cent of the net demand and time liabilities (NDTL) from 4.5 per cent. The decision is expected to infuse around ₹1.16 lakh crore liquidity into the banking system. (Pages 81-82)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: How did the median projection for the end-period repo rate for 2024-25 from the Survey of Professional Forecasters (SPF) compare with the actual policy rate maintained by the MPC as of the October 2024 report?

options.A: SPF projected a 25 bps higher rate.
options.B: SPF projected a 25 bps lower rate.
options.C: SPF projection was identical to the MPC's rate.
options.D: SPF projected a 50 bps lower rate.
options.E: SPF did not provide a repo rate projection.

questions.explanation: Table I.3 shows the median projection from the SPF for the end-period repo rate for 2024-25 is 6.25%. The MPC maintained the rate at 6.50%. Therefore, the SPF projected a rate 25 bps lower than the prevailing rate.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's Current Account Deficit (CAD) as a percentage of GDP in Q2 of FY25?
questions.explanation: India's current account deficit (CAD) moderated slightly to 1.2 per cent of GDP in Q2 of FY25, against 1.3 per cent of the GDP recorded in Q2 of FY24. (Page 149, Para 3.44)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The gross non-performing assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks declined to what level in June 2024?
questions.explanation: The asset quality of Scheduled Commercial Banks improved, with the overall gross non-performing assets (NPA) ratio declining to 2.7 per cent in June 2024 from 3.7 per cent a year ago.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Nobel Prize in Economics for 2024 was awarded to Claudia Goldin for her extensive research in which specific area?

options.E: The role of banks in financial crises

questions.explanation: Claudia Goldin was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics in October 2024 for her significant contributions and research on the gender gap in the labor market.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which statement is INCORRECT regarding the government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26 as announced in September 2025?

options.A: The gross market borrowing is planned at ₹6.77 lakh crore through 22 weekly auctions.
options.B: The borrowing includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
options.C: The largest share of borrowing (28.4%) will be under the 10-year security maturity.
options.D: Weekly borrowing through Treasury Bills in Q3 is expected to be ₹19,000 crore for 13 weeks.
options.E: The government reserves the right to exercise a greenshoe option of up to ₹5,000 crore against each security.

questions.explanation: All statements are correct except for the greenshoe option amount. The government will reserve the right to exercise a greenshoe option to retain an additional subscription of up to ₹2,000 crore, not ₹5,000 crore, against each of the securities indicated.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI revised the definition of 'Bulk Deposits' for Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) in October 2023. What is the new threshold for a single Rupee term deposit to be classified as a 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs?
questions.explanation: On October 26, 2023, the Reserve Bank enhanced the bulk deposit limit for RRBs. 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs would now mean single Rupee term deposits of ₹ one crore and above, revised from the earlier limit of '₹15 lakh and above'. (Page 146, para VI.33; Annex I, page 279)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the total amount the Government of India plans to borrow through dated securities in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The Government of India, in consultation with the RBI, finalized its borrowing programme and plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in the second half of FY 2025-26 through dated securities.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new Section 44BBD introduces a special provision for computing profits for non-residents providing services or technology for setting up electronics manufacturing in India. What percentage of the aggregate amounts received or paid is deemed to be profits and gains of such business?
questions.explanation: The new Section 44BBD(1) states that a sum equal to twenty-five per cent of the aggregate of specified amounts shall be deemed to be the profits and gains of the business of the non-resident assessee, chargeable to tax under 'Profits and gains of business or profession'. (Page 39, 145)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering the risk scenarios presented, a simultaneous 5% depreciation of the INR and a 10% rise in international crude oil prices above the baseline would likely increase headline inflation by approximately how many basis points?
questions.explanation: According to the risk scenarios, a 5% INR depreciation could increase inflation by around 35 bps, and a 10% rise in crude oil prices could increase it by 30 bps. The combined approximate impact would be 65 bps.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the central government's budgeted fiscal deficit to GDP ratio for the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The document states that the central government's fiscal deficit to GDP ratio declined to 4.8 per cent in 2024-25 and is budgeted to moderate further to 4.4 per cent in 2025-26. (Page 9)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged throughout 2023-24. What was this rate?
questions.explanation: Considering the growth-inflation dynamics, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent during 2023-24. (Page 29, para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Based on the 56th GST Council meeting recommendations, which of the following statements is/are correct? 
I. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies has been exempted. 
II. The inverted duty structure for the fertilizer sector was corrected by reducing GST on Sulphuric acid from 18% to 5%. 
III. GST on buses, trucks, and ambulances was reduced from 28% to 18%.
questions.explanation: All three statements are correct. The 56th GST Council meeting exempted GST on individual life and health insurance, corrected the inverted duty structure on inputs for fertilizers like Sulphuric acid by reducing the rate to 5%, and reduced the GST on commercial vehicles like buses and trucks to 18%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness
